summary: All 5 features tested and verified working: 1) Manual recipe recategorization with edit pencil, category toggles, and save/cancel buttons, 2) Screenshot upload helper text displays when no image selected, 3) 'I Cooked This' button calls /api/pantry/cook and deducts ingredients from pantry, 4) Category badges display correctly with icons on recipe detail page, 5) Recipe categories filter works on recipe library page
passed_tests: Backend: PUT /api/recipes/{id}/categories - creates recipe with categories
Backend: PUT /api/recipes/{id}/categories - updates recipe categories
Backend: PUT /api/recipes/{id}/categories - removes all categories
Backend: PUT /api/recipes/{id}/categories - returns 404 for invalid recipe
Backend: POST /api/pantry/cook - deducts ingredients from pantry
Backend: POST /api/pantry/cook - reports missing ingredients
Backend: POST /api/pantry/cook - returns 404 for non-existent recipe
Backend: POST /api/pantry/cook - respects servings multiplier
Backend: GET /api/recipes - returns categories field
Backend: Recipe filtering by category works
Frontend: Screenshot tab shows helper text when no image selected
Frontend: Extract Ingredients button disabled when no image
Frontend: Edit categories pencil button visible on recipe detail
Frontend: Category edit panel opens with all category toggles
Frontend: Category toggles can be selected/deselected
Frontend: Save categories button works and shows success toast
Frontend: Category badges display with icons (Vegan with leaf, Quick & Easy with lightning)
Frontend: 'I Cooked This' button visible and clickable
Frontend: 'I Cooked This' shows toast with deduction count
Frontend: Recipe library shows category filter buttons
Frontend: Category filter correctly filters recipes (6 -> 2 when Vegan selected)
Frontend: Category badges display on recipe cards in library
critical_code_review_comments: Category editing UI is well-implemented with proper state management
The cookRecipe API function correctly passes servings_multiplier parameter
Category filter in RecipeLibrary.jsx uses client-side filtering which is efficient for small datasets
seed_data_creation: Test recipes created during backend tests are automatically cleaned up via pytest fixtures
context_for_next_testing_agent: All P0 features from iteration 5 are working correctly. Category editing, pantry cook functionality, and category filtering are fully functional. Test file at /app/backend/tests/test_features_iteration5.py can be reused for regression testing.

manual_recipe_recategorization.details: Edit pencil button opens category panel, toggles work, save persists changes

screenshot_upload_helper_text.details: Helper text 'ðŸ‘† Upload an image above to enable extraction' shows when no image selected

i_cooked_this_button.details: Button calls /api/pantry/cook, shows toast with deduction count

category_badges_with_icons.details: Badges display with Lucide icons (Leaf for Vegan, Zap for Quick & Easy)

recipe_categories_filter.details: Filter buttons appear based on available categories, filtering works correctly
